titlestmt.titleproper: Sons of the Southern Confederacy: Joseph H. Jenkins Chapter records, Inclusive: 1902, 1951

did.head: Collection Summary

origination.label: Creator
origination.corpname: Sons of the Southern Confederacy: Joseph H. Jenkins Chapter

did.unittitle: Sons of the Southern Confederacy: Joseph H. Jenkins Chapter records
did.abstract: The Sons of the Southern Confederacy: Joseph H. Jenkins Chapter records contain a program from a 1902 veterans memorial service in McGregor, Texas, a photograph of a descendant of a veteran, and some poetry about the veterans.

bioghist.head: Biography/Profile
bioghist.p: The Sons of the Southern Confederacy were one of many Civil War veterans-affiliated groups active in the late 1800s and early 1900s. This particular branch, the Joseph H. Jenkins chapter, was active in Houston, Texas. While it is unknown when the Sons of the Southern Confederacy group disbanded, many similar groups eventually joined or merged with the Sons of Confederate Veterans organization throughout the mid-1900s.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: The Sons of the Southern Confederacy: Joseph H. Jenkins Chapter records contain a program, photograph, and poetry. The program, from a 1902 Confederate veterans memorial service in McGregor, Texas, was hosted by the Sons and Daughters of the Southern Confederacy, thought to be a local organization. The photograph is of a descendant of a veteran, with no name given. The poetry about the veterans is memorial in nature and is written on a card that was mailed to The Texas Collection.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The Sons of the Southern Confederacy: Joseph H. Jenkins Chapter records were arranged in one folder. After the current round of processing, they fill two folders.
Currently, the Sons of the Southern Confederacy: Joseph H. Jenkins Chapter records contains two series: I. Reunion and II. Veteran.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: All requests for copying of materials must be submitted to The Texas Collection in writing. Please use the Request Form for Copying Materials sheet. Unpublished materials authored or otherwise produced by the creator (s) of this collection are in the public domain. There are no restrictions on use. Copyright status for other collection materials is unknown. Transmission or reproduction of materials protected by U.S. Copyright Law (Title 17, U.S.C.) beyond that allowed by fair use requires the written permission of the copyright owners. Works not in the public domain cannot be commercially exploited without permission of the copyright owners. Responsibility for any use rests exclusively with the user.

userestrict.head: Use/Re-use Restrictions
userestrict.p: The collection is open for research.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Described by Paul T. Fisher. Released on 2020-08-28.

bioghist.head: Biography/Profile
bioghist.p: This series contains a program for a memorial service for Confederate veterans, hosted by the Sons and Daughters of the Confederacy, in 1902. This series is in poor condition.

bioghist.head: Biography/Profile
bioghist.p: This series contains a card with memorial poetry, together with an envelope, and a photograph of a member of the Sons of the Southern Confederacy Joseph H. Jenkins Chapter in Houston, Texas. The series is in good condition.
